controlFamilyDescription: Focus is on who can access what assets and ensures proper account management, system privileges, and remote access logging.
Focus is on establishing audit policies and procedures, keeping track of audit logs, generating reports, and safeguarding valuable audit information.
Focus is on security training and records to enhance awareness and equip your staff with the knowledge to stay vigilant against threats.

Focus is on establishing policies for system configurations, maintaining inventories of information system components, and conducting security impact analysis to ensure a strong foundation for future builds or changes.
Focus is on creating contingency plans to tackle cybersecurity incidents effectively, including testing and training to backups and system recovery.
Focus is on ensuring only authorized individuals gain access through identity verification and authentication processes for organizational and non-organizational users.
Focus is on establishing policies and procedures for incident response, including training, testing, monitoring, reporting, and a comprehensive response plan.
Focus is on outlining security requirements for maintaining organizational systems and the tools used to support them, ensuring their continued reliability and performance.
Focus is on safeguarding physical media, such as storage devices, with control enhancements for access, marking, storage, transport policies, sanitization, and defined organizational media use.
Focus is on protecting them through NIST risk assessment, screening, termination procedures, access agreements, and more.
Focus is on access authorizations, emergency protocols, power management, fire protection, and more to ensure your systems remain secure in the physical world.

Focus is on ensuring the proper handling of personally identifiable information (PII). This includes the collection, use, sharing, and retention of such information. Aims to improve transparency through clear privacy policies, user consent mechanisms, and providing user access to their PII.
Focus is on covering the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination, industry standards, and organizational compliance necessary for effective security planning.
Focus is on establishing critical infrastructure plans, information security program plans, and risk management frameworks which aligns your enterprise architecture with your security objectives.
Focus is on assessing vulnerabilities and conducting regular scans to identify potential risks.
Focus is on security assessments, authorizations, and continuous monitoring and establishes plans for ongoing security standards improvements.

Focus is on guarding your systems and communications against various threats through boundary protection, cryptographic measures, and denial-of-service protection to secure information at rest to ensure the safety of your digital interactions.
Focus is on vulnerability remediation, monitoring, protection against malicious code, software and firmware integrity, and safeguards.

Focus is on identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with the supply chain for information systems and components. This includes third-party risk management, ensuring secure procurement, and maintaining supplier oversight to protect computing system integrity and data confidentiality.

Focus is on legal authority that permits the collection, use, maintenance, and sharing of personally identifiable information (PII), either generally or in support of a specific program or information system need.
Focus is on identifying and documenting information systems and resources, as well as the individuals who access them.
Focus is on verifying that an organization only collects and retains the minimum amount of personally identifiable information (PII) necessary to fulfill its legally authorized purpose.
Focus is on ensuring consent, access, and complaint management of individuals with regard to their personally identifiable information (PII).
Focus is on tracking the inventory of an individual's personally identifiable information (PII) as well a incident responses.
Focus is on notice of privacy and privacy records as well as how the privacy program is disseminated.
Focus is on the proper use of personally identifiable information (PII) internally and 3rd parties.
Focus is on security when acquiring new systems and services.
Focus is on ensuring quality and integrity of personally identifiable information type of data.

The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, dependencies, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood.
The organization’s current cybersecurity risks are understood.
Safeguards to manage the organization’s cybersecurity risk are used.
Possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises are found and analyzed.
Actions regarding a detected cybersecurity incident are taken.
